data.title: Wonderful food, welcoming service
data.text: We had a party of four business travelers - just arrived in Rockville on a rainy night - for a business meeting the next day - and looking for someplace to have a quick dinner.  We showed up on their doorstep just 30 minutes before closing.  It was like being greeted by family.  They took us in, fed us wonderful Greek food (even the vegetarian among us) and wine, and even complementary dessert.  The plates of food were huge!  They couldn't have been nicer and we really had a wonderful time.

data.title: Magnificent Greek Food
data.text: Amazing restaurant with true Greek ambiance! We had a family celebration dinner and the service was superb and our meal was truly amazing!! Octopus lovers will be in heaven!!! Delicious hallumi and a superb wine list!!! Very much a treat

data.title: Now they have special group dinners
data.text:
I'm a regular here but they continue to come up with new things. The latest were 2 special 4 course dinner options. We chose the $30 per person rather than the $40 option.
It starts with a generous salad and 3 appetizers, hummus etc. All dishes are family style. 
The meat course had 4 items - pork, chicken, sausage and lamb.  Delicious! 

Save room for a sweet dessert.

data.title: Best Greek food
data.text: We had our granddaughters christening at Trapezaria Mediterranean Kuzina restaurant in Rockville Maryland last Sunday. It was the most beautiful gathering ever. The Restaurant is beautifully decorated and very clean. The food was out of this world prepared by executive chef Michel with his unlimited curinary talent for authentic Greek cuisine and enormous portions. I am still getting thank you calls from our guests raving about the food service and owner Bill. I am recommending this unique Restaurant to anyone looking for a delicious meal, good service, romantic atmosphere and great prices. Thank you Bill, Alexandra.

data.title: Great food in a comfortable family run local stylish resturant
data.text:
We have brought many family and friends here. Don't miss their home made eggplant and pine nuts appetizer to share. We love their moussaka, any fish Greek style, lamb, everything we tried we've enjoyed.
I have had business lunches here too. Helpful serving staff. 
Make a reservation.

data.title: Yummy and well presented
data.text:
We enjoyed this tasty place two times once as a date night and another as a mom and son dinner.  Both times were cordial and welcoming though the tile room made it feel a bit chilled for fall and winter.  

I recommend this restaurant for warm weather.

The food was delicious and favors fresh.  He dishes were attractively presented.  The fish was fresh and very tasty in its sauce.

data.title: Attention to the taste details
data.text: We were here for the first time. It was for dinner. We were impressed by the attention to unique flavorings for each dish we tried and for the attention paid to preparation. A conversation with the owner/chef helped to reinforce our opinion. From the complimentary dish of ground fava and olive oil placed on the table to the octopus, lamb and seafood, all was very tasty. Nice to see that they are striving for authentic, rather than commercial Greek food.The lamb is cooked slowly to achieve tenderness, Worth a try for you. One comment though. They tend to be a little heavy on the salt. You might want them to go easy, if they can on your order. Hopefully, they will see this review and ease up a little on the salt. With such wonderful flavorings, salt should be used minimally.

data.title: Amazing Greek food!!!!
data.text: This is the BEST food in Rockville Town Center!! True and traditional Greek food! Huge portions and great prices. Beautiful restaurant and very clean! Wonderful service and delicious food! A must go to!!! 🇬🇷

data.title: A sumptuous feast!!
data.text:
My wife ordered the vegetable platter, I went for the pork appetizer.. Wait a minute!! Emilio, our waiter suggested that I consider the platter as it consist of a salad, potatoes and pork with the Greek bread.. I went for it.. What a meal.. Emilio's suggestion for the vegetable platter for my wife was on the spot.. My pork platter was fabulous.. Greek salad immersed in feta cheese, potatoes that are heavenly roasted and huge chunks of porky goodness and what looks like a yogurt dip with chives was the best meal we had in a while.. Emilio led us into the journey of discovering the dishes that they offered. He suggested that we try the whole fish and the lamb chops the next time we are in.. 
As a waiter, Emilio not only did his job by taking our orders and making sure our dinner was great, he was our guide in his restaurants menu and how they made things.. Allowing us to further educate our palates into what they have t offer.. I met Billy, the owner.. Great guy.. Keep on traveling and keep on eating.. Rolly H..

data.title: Greece in downtown Rockville.
data.text:
Food and staff are good. Prices are okay for Greek good. Can find better prices, but this is a nicer place, but your typical Greek mom and pop place. Parking isn't great, as there are spaces behind the building or in the town center. Also, ive driven by it many times and didn't know it was there. 
Definitely a great place if your looking to try something new and your sick of all the chain places.

data.title: Amazing - highly recommended
data.text: What amazing authentic food. The chef used to cook for a Royal family. If you're ever in these parts - this is a definite go to restaurant. The staff is friendly, the prices are extremely reasonable, and the portions are amazing. Thank you for an awesome lunch. 💗

data.title: Go for a delicious happy hour!
data.text:
They have a pretty bar and a lovely, sunny restaurant--and the happy hour offerings are both delicious and reasonably priced! They offer fresh pita wedges and a scrumptious fava bean dip while you wait for your food, but I suggest getting a selection of their other dips to go along with it. They're all SO GOOD, you'll want to lick the cute little presentation bowls right down to the bottom. Get the gyro sliders for a very satisfying, meaty choice. The little flat bread pizza things are pretty good too, but unless you're looking for straight-up comfort food, might be best left to the kiddies.
We also tried a whole fish (some local Greek specialty fish) and while tender and well cooked (not dry), it was a bit flavorless and didn't have much "Greek" going for it. However, the side dishes that came with it were quite yummy.
Wait staff behind the bar have been a bit hit-or-miss (some were great, others scattered and inattentive), but overall we've always had a great time :)  We'll keep coming back to try new things and enjoy this lovely little place!

data.title: delicious Greek food
data.text: Nicely decorated friendly service and amazing food. If you like Greek seafood this is the place to visit. Staff is very attentive, food comes in nice portions.I am allergic to seafood, but everyone in our party except me and my son-in-law had fish. The grilled Octopus seemed to be the rave in our party. I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you want to experience Greek food.

data.title: Good Greek Food, Friendly Atmosphere
data.text: We enjoyed our meal at Trapezaria.  Atmosphere is friendly, white tablecloth.  Definitely a taste of Cyprus, with excellent slow cooked lamb, chicken stuffed with feta, and fried calamari.  Portions are large, so you'll need to ask for a take home box.  The bar pours an excellent and generous martini.  Parking is convenient and free after 6 p.m., but you have to look for it; just drive around the block looking for the open gate and the Trapezaria parking sign.  There's a restaurant door right off the lot.  One of the best Greek restaurants in the DC area.

data.title: Very nice happy hour!
data.text:
Read all the reviews and gave it the good ol' college try. While the food happy hour choices are limited, they are excellent - specially the sliders, chicken skewers and the three dip selection.  Sandy the bar keep is very friendly and makes excellent cocktails.

We enjoyed it so much, that we went back for a guys night out.

data.title: Added an Early Bird for Seniors
data.text:
It's easy to like the Greek food inspired Trapezaria Kuzina.  It got a top 100 rating in the DC area a few years back when it opened and we've frequented it from time to time.  But now they have added an $11.99,  3 course early bird special for seniors.
My wife and I qualify and had the hearty bean soup of the day along with a cheesy Trapezaria Greek salad and I entry. I had a succulent pork platter and my wife tried the lamb gyro platter.  Both were tasty and accompanied by lemon potatoes and very soft bread.

data.title: Good but not exceptional
data.text: Given the atmosphere, one might expect exceptional food.  The old standby Greek restaurants like Ambrosia had better versions of lamb, roast potatoes, and green beans (why do some Greek restaurants have to cook them until they are grey).

data.title: Good food
data.text: Roast lamb special was excellent. Chicken kabob was very good. Greek wine was superb!  The waiter was very good.  The atmosphere was delightfully.

data.title: Overrated, but pleasant
data.text:
I love Greek food. Since my favorite restaurant closed I was thrilled to find a new one opening.  Unfortunately, I found it mediocre at best, and definitely overpriced for the quality.

However, it does have a lovely ambience. If you don't mind very Americanized Greek food, it could provide a pleasant evening.

data.title: Huge portions
data.text: Went for lunch and had the flank steak salad. I've been sick of the tiny portions of food served elsewhere, so this was a pleasant surprise. Served large portions of the steak and salad, plus soup. Very nice ambience also, with blue and white as the main colors, reminding me of such a place as Santorini. Lovely.
